text: The UEFA Women's Euro 2013 (also called the Women's Euro 2013) was the 11th UEFA Women's Championship tournament. It took place in Sweden and it lasted from 10–28 July. The champions were Germany, winning their 6th consecutive title, and their 8th overall. == Teams == * * * * * * * * * * * * (hosts) == Group stage == Key to colours in group tables Team advanced to the Quarter-finals === Group A === Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts Sweden 3 2 1 0 9 2 +7 7 Italy 3 1 1 1 3 4 –1 4 Denmark 3 0 2 1 3 4 –1 2 Finland 3 0 2 1 1 6 –5 2 8 June 2015 Italy 0 – 0 Sweden 1 – 1 12 June 2015 Italy 2 – 1 Finland 0 – 5 16 June 2015 Sweden 3 – 1 Denmark 1 – 1 === Group B === Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts Norway 3 2 1 0 3 1 +2 7 Germany 3 1 1 1 3 1 +2 4 Iceland 3 1 1 1 2 4 –2 4 Netherlands 3 0 1 2 0 2 –2 1 9 June 2015 Norway 1 – 1 Germany 0 – 0 13 June 2015 Norway 1 – 0 Iceland 0 – 3 17 June 2015 Germany 0 – 1 Netherlands 0 – 1 === Group C === Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts France 3 3 0 0 7 1 +6 9 Spain 3 1 1 1 4 4 0 4 Russia 3 0 2 1 3 5 –2 2 England 3 0 1 2 3 7 –4 1 9 June 2015 France 3 – 1 England 2 – 3 13 June 2015 England 1 – 1 Spain 0 – 1 17 June 2015 France 3 – 0 Russia 1 – 1 === Third placed teams === Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts Iceland 3 1 1 1 2 4 –2 4 Denmark 3 0 2 1 3 4 –1 2 Russia 3 0 2 1 3 5 –2 2 == Knockout stage == {{Round8 |21 July | Sweden|4| Iceland|0 |21 July | Italy|0| Germany|1 |22 July | Norway|3| Spain|1 |22 July | France|1 (2)| Denmark (pen)|1 (4) |24 July | Sweden|0| Germany|1 |25 July | Norway (pen)|1 (4)| Denmark|1 (2) |28 July | Germany|1| Norway|0 }} Category:2013 in association football Category:UEFA Category:2013 in Sweden
